text: <extra_id_0> Grf40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , A novel Grb2 family member , is involved in T cell signaling through interaction with <extra_id_0> SLP-76 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> LAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
We molecularly cloned a new Grb2 family member , named <extra_id_0> Grf40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , containing the common SH3-SH2-SH3 motif .
Expression of <extra_id_0> Grf40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is predominant in hematopoietic cells , particularly T cells .

<extra_id_0> Grf40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds to the <extra_id_0> SH2 domain-containing leukocyte protein of 76 kD <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> SLP-76 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) via its SH3 domain more tightly than <extra_id_0> Grb2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Incidentally , <extra_id_0> Grf40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds to <extra_id_0> linker for activation of T cells <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> LAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) possibly via its SH2 domain .

Overexpression of wild-type <extra_id_0> Grf40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in Jurkat cells induced a significant increase of <extra_id_0> SLP-76 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent <extra_id_0> interleukin (IL)-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter and nuclear factor of activated T cell ( NF-AT ) activation upon T cell receptor ( TCR ) stimulation , whereas the COOH-terminal SH3 - deleted <extra_id_0> Grf40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutant lacked any recognizable increase in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity .

Furthermore , the SH2 - deleted <extra_id_0> Grf40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutant led to a marked inhibition of these regulatory activities , the effect of which is apparently stronger than that of the SH2 - deleted <extra_id_0> Grb2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutant .

Our data suggest that <extra_id_0> Grf40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an adaptor molecule involved in TCR - mediated signaling through a more efficient interaction than <extra_id_0> Grb2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with <extra_id_0> SLP-76 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> LAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
